title: How I Get Free Traffic from ChatGPT in 2025 (AIO vs SEO)

search_results.title: This is how you get free traffic from ChatGPT and Google in 2025
search_results.content:
💥 17.5 Billion Daily Searches.
Google is still king 👑…
But did you know that 20%+ discovery is Google's spring?
Crazy, right?😳
Some of our clients are even getting more leads from ChatGPT than Google!
👉 SEO is no longer just “Search Engine Optimization.”
It's Search Everywhere Optimization.🌐
Here's how to win in 2025:
✓ Optimize for all search engines — not just Google
🔍 Strengthen your entity (schema, Wikidata, clear brand identity)
📚 Publish source-of-truth content — pricing, FAQs, integrations
📊 Create original data — studies, insights, benchmarks
📰Earn citations from trusted sites
🧠 Build strong author identities (bios + credentials)
💬 Seed content in AI-read communities (Reddit, YouTube, Quora)
📈 Track visibility beyond Google — ChatGPT, Perplexity, Gemini mentions [...] 🚀 𝟏𝟕.𝟓 𝐁𝐈𝐋𝐋𝐈𝐎𝐍 𝐬𝐞𝐚𝐫𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐬 𝐚 𝐝𝐚𝐲.
Google is still the whale 🐋… but 20%+ of discovery now lives outside it.
💥 Some of our clients get more leads from ChatGPT than Google.
SEO isn’t just “Search Engine Optimization” anymore — it’s Search Everywhere 🌍.
🔍 Here’s how to win in 2025 and beyond:
✅ Optimize for all search engines (Google, Bing, ChatGPT, Perplexity)
✅ Nail your entity: clear name, schema, Wikidata
✅ Ship source-of-truth: pricing, FAQs, integrations
✅ Create proprietary data: studies, benchmarks
✅ Earn citations from trusted sites & media
✅ Standardize author identity: bios, credentials
✅ Seed communities AI models read: Reddit, YouTube
✅ Measure beyond SERPs: ChatGPT & Perplexity mentions
📈 SEO is no longer just rankings — it’s reputation, reach, and relevance. [...] View profile for Fery Kaszoni

This is how you get free traffic from ChatGPT and Google in 2025:

Every month, create listicles on 5 other websites about “The best companies in your industry” with you being on top
£3,500 per month (£42,000 / year)

Total spend:

And that is how you get FREE traffic from ChatGPT and Google.

search_results.title: How I Get Free Traffic from ChatGPT in 2025 (AIO vs SEO)
search_results.content:
These generated prompts become your AIO keyword targets, the queries you optimize for and track in your monitoring system.

## Your Next Steps

The AIO opportunity window is still wide open. Most businesses are still focused exclusively on traditional SEO, which means less competition for AI model citations. Start Here:

### Phase 1: Research and Setup

### Phase 2: Authority Building

### Phase 3: Scale and Iterate

Remember: AIO doesn’t replace SEO; it supplements it. You still need traditional search optimization, but now you also need to optimize for AI model responses.

The businesses that master both will dominate organic traffic in the coming years.

### Related Articles

Google AIO optimization kit

## Google AIO Optimization: Free Toolkit to Get Your Site Mentioned in AI Answers [...] This isn’t luck. It’s the result of implementing AI Optimization (AIO), where I optimize my content to appear in AI-generated responses. And if you’re still only focusing on traditional SEO, you’re missing out on a massive traffic source that’s growing exponentially.

## The SEO-to-AIO Evolution

For years, our organic traffic strategy looked only like this:

This system worked because Google was the primary gateway to information.

Don’t get me wrong, you still need to optimize for Google search results, but to increase your chances of online visibility, you’ll also have to optimize your content for AI Models, because many people ditched Google and are using only them to search for stuff online, like: [...] Each platform processes queries differently, but they all share one thing: they’re trained to provide direct human-like answers rather than just a list of links.

So, in conclusion, if your content gets selected as a source on AI models, you win. If it doesn’t, you’re invisible.

### Google AI Mode

Google AI Mode: google.com/ai

Google’s AI Mode is a new search experience that replaces the traditional list of links with human-like direct answers, which people prefer. While Google has stated that AI Mode will potentially become the default Google Search experience “soon,” it has since walked back on this statement.

search_results.title: ChatGPT Traffic Boost: AIO vs SEO Strategies for 2025
search_results.content:
SEO is dying fast.
Your $10K/month SEO agency is optimizing for a search engine that won't exist in 2 years.
Meanwhile, 89% of people never scroll past ChatGPT's first answer.
The game changed. And nobody's telling you.
Here's what happened:
Google used to give you 10 blue links.
Now? AI Overviews. One answer. Zero clicks to your site.
ChatGPT doesn't link to you.
Perplexity doesn't link to you.
Claude doesn't link to you.
Your entire SEO strategy just became worthless.
But here's the kicker:
89% of AI citations come from third-party articles.
Not your blog posts.
Not your website content.
Not your keyword-stuffed landing pages.
Earned media from 3rd party, trustworthy cites.
THAT'S what AI trusts.
So while your SEO agency is:
→ Chasing backlinks (outdated) [...] The result?
Within three months:
ChatGPT started referencing our guides
Perplexity cited our breakdowns
Gemini surfaced our FAQs
Google organic growth accelerated again
Engagement metrics kept improving
We didn’t just gain rankings.
We gained AI credibility.
We’re no longer in a single-engine world.
We’re in a hybrid search ecosystem:
Google SEO + AI SEO + Entity SEO + Semantic Trust
If your strategy still revolves only around:
keyword density
backlinks
“SEO-optimized” content
You will fall behind.
The future belongs to brands that:
Strengthen entities
Write for AI understanding
Build deep topical authority
Earn semantic trust
Get referenced by LLMs
This is the new SEO reality.
If you want a 2026-ready audit, DM me. [...] 🚀 New tech article from TechCrunch: How I Get Free Traffic from ChatGPT in 2025 (AIO vs SEO)
Three weeks ago, I tested something that completely changed how I think about organic traffic. I opened ChatGPT and asked a simple question: "What's the best course on building SaaS with WordPress?" The answer that appeared stopped me cold. My course showed up as the first result, recommended directly by the AI with specific reasons why it was valuable.

search_results.title: The AI Search Reckoning Is Dismantling Open Web Traffic
search_results.content:
In fact, some data suggests users may actually be clicking more links as they get used to AI interfaces. The zero-click rate of search keywords that feature AI Overviews has actually dropped from more than 45% in January 2025 to 38% as of October, according to Semrush.

ChatGPT won’t save pubs

But Google is far from the only AI search platform gobbling up publisher referral traffic – and even those sending more traffic than others, like ChatGPT, aren’t enough to offset the losses.

ChatGPT is the biggest referrer of traffic among emerging AI chat and search interfaces. It sent 1.2 billion outgoing referrals to publisher sites between September and November, Digiday reported last month, citing data from Similarweb, a 52% year-over-year increase. [...] But don’t be too encouraged by growing referral numbers. They’re a drop in the bucket. Digiday also noted that traffic from all AI platforms combined accounts for just 1% of all publisher traffic, citing research from SEO platform Conductor.

And, besides, ChatGPT may not be sharing the wealth equally.

Certain publishers have disproportionately benefited from ChatGPT referrals over time, according to Josh Blyskal, answer engine optimization strategy and research lead at Profound. He noted that a 52% reduction in ChatGPT referrals to websites between July and August coincided with a 53% increase in citations to Wikipedia, Reddit and TechRadar.

Canaries in the coal mine

Still, the horror stories outnumber the far smaller number of publisher success stories with AI search referrals. [...] ### AdExchanger Daily

Get our editors’ roundup delivered to your inbox every weekday.

## Daily Roundup

### As The Economy Goes, So Does Ad Spend; Microsoft AI Plays Nice With Pubs

Recent changes to Google’s search experience have been particularly hard on pubs, and simply linking a few sources in AIO results isn’t enough to help their traffic.

When an AIO is featured at the top of Google’s search page, just 1% of users click the links it cites, according to a July Pew Research study.

AIOs also ding the organic search results that appear below them. Just 8% of users click on the blue links under an AIO, compared with 15% who click a link when there’s no AIO present, as per Pew.
